intro: Thespesia howii, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 feet. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. Thespesia howii is adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and plays an important role in the local ecosystem.
